member.name: M:GrapeCity.Common.GcNetFxLicenseProvider`1.VerifyDesignTimeEnvironment
member.summary: Verify the environment to get whether the component is in design-time.
member.returns: true if it is in design-time; otherwise false.
member.remarks: In DesignTime, because of IDE bugs, some component are not created with DesigntimeLicenseContext. For example, when drag a control from Win Forms DataSource tool window, or use a web control in a ASP.NET Template. This may cause the control do run-time license validation and found that there is no license. To resolve this problem, we will check the environment and decide whether to do design-time license validation again.

If errorAmount is ErrorAmount.Percentage, the value property is a percentage number value between 0 and 1. If errorAmount is ErrorAmount.StandardDeviation, the value property is a percentage number of calculated standard deviation value.

member.name: T:C1.Win.Chart.Palettes.Qualitative
member.remarks: Qualitative (or categorical) palettes are usually used for plotting independent data categories which don't have any specific order. For example, the series that represents shipping methods or product types.The colors in these palettes are selected to be distinctive and clearly indicate difference between data series.

member.name: T:C1.Win.Chart.Palettes.Diverging
member.remarks: Qualitative (or categorical) palettes are usually used for plotting independent data categories which don't have any specific order. For example, the series that represents shipping methods or product types.The colors in these palettes are selected to be distinctive and clearly indicate difference between data series.

member.name: T:C1.Win.Chart.Palettes.SequentialSingle
member.summary: Sequential single-hue palettes from ColorBrewer https://colorbrewer2.org .
member.remarks: Sequential palettes are used for data that have ordered, quantitative nature, for example precipitation amount or number of road incidents for some region.These color schemes are shade variations of a single base color, usually from light to dark.

member.name: T:C1.Win.Chart.Palettes.SequentialMulti
member.summary: Sequential multi-hue palettes from ColorBrewer https://colorbrewer2.org .
member.remarks: Sequential palettes are used for data that have ordered, quantitative nature, for example precipitation amount or number of road incidents for some region.In addition to lightness variation, these color schemes also use several hues to improve perception.

member.summary: Restore the property to its default value.

member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the DataMember, if any, for the DataSource.

member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the property that contains numeric values for the pie slices.

member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the property that contains label for the pie slices and legend.

member.name: P:C1.Win.Chart.FlexPie.StartAngle
member.summary: Gets or sets the starting angle for the pie slices, in degrees.
member.remarks: Angles are measured clockwise, starting at the 9 o'clock position.

member.name: P:C1.Win.Chart.FlexPie.InnerRadius
member.summary: Gets or sets the size of the pie's inner radius.
member.remarks: The inner radius is measured as a fraction of the pie radius. The default value for this property is zero, which creates a pie. Setting this property to values greater than zero creates pies with a hole in the middle, also known as doughnut charts.

member.name: P:C1.Win.Chart.FlexPie.Offset
member.summary: Gets or sets the offset of the slices from the pie center.
member.remarks: The offset is measured as a fraction of the pie radius.

member.name: P:C1.Win.Chart.FlexPie.Reversed
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that determines whether angles are reversed (counter-clockwise).
member.remarks: The default value is false, which causes angles to be measured in the clockwise direction.

member.name: P:C1.Win.Chart.FlexPie.SelectedItemPosition
member.summary: Gets or sets the position of the selected slice.
member.remarks: Setting this property to a value other than 'None' causes the pie to rotate when an item is selected. Note that in order to select slices by clicking the chart, you must set the SelectionMode property to "Point".

member.name: P:C1.Win.Chart.FlexPie.SelectedItemOffset
member.summary: Gets or sets the offset of the selected slice from the pie center.
member.remarks: Offsets are measured as a fraction of the pie radius.

member.name: P:C1.Win.Chart.FlexPie.Titles
member.summary: Gets or sets the pie titles.
member.remarks: The titles are shown above each pie chart when multiple properties are specified in Binding. If the Titles is null (default value) the binding property names are used as pie titles.

summary.para: Provides static methods that should be called from the constructors of licensed classes.
Also provides a static method that can be called to show the about box with product and licensing information.

member.name: M:C1.Util.Licensing.ProviderInfo.Validate(System.Type,System.Object)
member.summary: Perform license validation. Call this method from the licensed object's constructor to save a license key at design time, validate it at runtime, and display a nag dialog if a valid license is not found.
member.param: Type of licensed object (use typeof() and not GetType()).
Reference to the licensed object (not currently used).
member.returns: A object that contains information about the license.

remarks.para: Check the ShouldNag property of the returned to determine whether the licensed class should nag the user. This value is set to true in situations where a valid license was not found but a nag dialog could not be displayed. In these cases, the licensed class is supposed to nag in some other way (with a watermark for example).

member.name: M:C1.Util.Licensing.ProviderInfo.Validate(System.Type,System.Object,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Perform license validation. Call this method from the licensed object's constructor to save a license key at design time, validate it at runtime, and display a nag dialog if a valid license is not found.
member.param: Type of licensed object (use typeof() and not GetType()).
Reference to the licensed object (not currently used).
Whether the nag dialog should be displayed when a valid license is not found.
member.returns: A object that contains information about the license.

remarks.para: This overload was created for use in WPF. It should be called in the control's constructor in order to support license persistence correctly. But it should not show the nag dialog until the control is fully loaded, or the VS designer may remain blank.

member.name: M:C1.Util.Licensing.ProviderInfo.Validate(System.Type,System.Object,System.Reflection.Assembly,System.String)
member.summary: Version of Validate used by constructors that take runtime keys.
member.param: Type of licensed object (use typeof() and not GetType()).
Assembly that contains the owner licensed control.
member.returns: A with information about the runtime key.

remarks.para: This allows a licensed C1 class to create other C1 objects bypassing license verification for the child objects.
For extra safety, we check that the owner object is defined in an assembly the contains a 'C1ProductInfo' attribute.

member.name: M:C1.Util.Licensing.ProviderInfo.ShowAboutBox(System.Object)
member.summary: Shows the About Box for an instance of a C1 product.

member.summary: Get the type whose assembly contains a 'C1ProductInfoAttribute'.
member.param: Instance of an object whose type is to be checked.
member.returns: The type whose assembly contains a 'C1ProductInfoAttribute'
